issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fixVersions.description: Problems for which fixes are not expected.
fixVersions.name: Known Issue

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
The IBM JDK 1.4.2 reports the declared fields of a class in reverse declaration order. The tests are affected by this:

{noformat}
Testsuite: org.apache.commons.lang.builder.BuilderTestSuite
Tests run: 263, Failures: 8, Errors: 0, Time elapsed: 0,451 sec

Testcase:
testReflectionHierarchyHashCode(org.apache.commons.lang.builder.HashCodeBuilderTest):
FAILED
expected:<11785967> but was:<1276487>
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: expected:<11785967> but was:<1276487>
        at
org.apache.commons.lang.builder.HashCodeBuilderTest.testReflectionHierarchyHashCode(HashCodeBuilderTest.java:166)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at
sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:85)
        at
sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:58)
        at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:60)

expected:<862547> but was:<865283>
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: expected:<862547> but was:<865283>

        at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:60)

fields.summary: HashCodeBuilderTest and ToStringBuilderTest fail with IBM JDK 1.4.2

comments.body: This is not an issue with IBM JDK 1.5.0_3 anymore.
I think we have to view the reverse order as a JVM bug. We should add code to ignore these tests when on the IBM 1.4 JVM for 3.0.

I don't see any reason to have the unit tests not run for this - makes them more honest and we don't need the IBM 1.4.2 JVM to develop with. Marking as WONTFIX as it's a JVM bug (they fixed in 1.5 so presuming it's considered so).
